Description: Small axe head made of black basalt, rectangular shape tapered towards the butt. The front side is very well smoothed and suggests a reuse of a former grinding stone, the back side is eroded and rough. A small area at the butt end is chipped off. The blade is well smoothed and sharp, no wear marks visible. The section is quite straight, slightly tapered towards the blade.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amara West (Nubia), E13, south-west corner of the square, surface
Bibliographic references: Spencer 1997 / Amara West I, The Architectural Report (p. 234)
